instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only works while the charger is plugged in
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only works while the charger is plugged in if the Mac is on and the power cable is removed the Mac turns off right away.

<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> are both fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only works while the charger is plugged in
threads.message:
OSX recognizes battery?
Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with both charger and battery connected.
Next post 3V42 and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with battery only.
Both sections of <DIODE>D7005</DIODE> OK?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only works while the charger is plugged in
threads.message: Post exact voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with the Charger no battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only works while the charger is plugged in
threads.message:
OSX recognizes battery, condition is good with only 44 charge cycles, the charger is charging with very low 0.69watts so the charge doesn't go up.

[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.57v with charger and battery

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.56v with charger only[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 7.82v with battery only[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only works while the charger is plugged in
threads.message:
Tried another battery? This sounds like a bad battery to me...

Very possible corrosion under battery connector OR that <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is off because of a blown <RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR>. Check that resistor first as well as corrosion near battery FPC. If both ok, likely bad battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only works while the charger is plugged in
threads.message:
Thanks, I was puzzled and did not even check the battery after checking the board, battery was original one with few charge cycles.

New battery fixed the problem.
